column1: One night there came a terrible storm of wind and rain. When I awoke in the morning
column3: there were the old robins flying about the garden in great distress
column5: that I went out to see what was the matter. What do you think I saw?The pretty nest was on the ground
column6: torn in pieces by the wind; and the little baby-birds lay in the cold wet grass
column7: crying pitifully. The old birds were flying about
column8: and beating the grass with their wings.I ran to the house
column9: and found an old tin pail. I lined this with nice hay from Billy's stable
column10: picked up the poor little robins
column11: and put them in the warm dry hay. Then I hung the pail on a branch of the bush
column12: tied it firmly with some twine
column13: and went into the house to watch the old birds from my window.
